dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it going, Jacko?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT between JACK and JACK SR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. I took the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you. I was wondering what  happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to call you, dad, but they  said your line was disconnected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jovially) Ah yes, I moved house. Needed a  bigger place. How's that book of  yours coming along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the sitting room MARION looks towards JACK in the  bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to have the job to fall  back on, isn't it? (pause) There goes my other phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up. MARION turns the last page of the typescript She's finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK comes in from the bedroom. MARION says nothing. She  puts the typescript down. JACK waits. MARION gets off the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like it at all. You had a  wonderful character before, the  Gambler. He was so romantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a loser. This guy's a  croupier. He can't lose. People  have shat on him all his life. Now  he's in control. He's a winner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that your idea of a winner? He  doesn't give a shit about anyone.  He uses people and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) -- It's because of the sex, isn't  it? You don't like the sex in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a fuck about the sex.  Most men'll fuck a lamppost. He's  just a miserable zombie. Is that  the way you feel now? Is that what's  happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marion. It's a book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh really. Then why is he called  Jake. Why don't you come clean and  call him Jack. (softens) There's no hope in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without hope there's no point to  anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now wait a minute. What's so hopeful  about your job? Spending the day  catching poor people stealing. You  said yourself the organised gangs  get away with it. At least in the  casino everybody gets caught. Rich  or poor, the odds are the same.  It's all relative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crap. It's not relative. It's  unfair. Like your casino. It's  designed unfair. And your croupier's  a little shit because he goes along  with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK sees MARION is getting really angry. He crosses the  room, Pointedly takes MARION'S handbag, opens it, takes  out a National Lottery card and receipt. The doorbell rin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coldly) You're just like all those other  dummies out there. Fourteen and a  half million to one! Is that your  idea of hope?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorbell rings again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Answer it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK hands her the lottery card and goes to the door, ope it.  BELLA stands there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking little shit! You shopped  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARION watches, numb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynolds got a doctor in. They  forced me to take a dope test. It  was positive. As you knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know anything about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BELLA looks over to MARION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your boyfriend fucked me, smoked  my dope, then shopped me. What do  you think of that? I can't get a  job now. (to Jack) You bastard. You're no different  from Matt. A pair of vicious little  shits, that's what you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly) Look Bella, I don't know anything  about this. You should talk to  Matt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all scumbags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without looking at MARION, BELLA suddenly kisses JACK on  the lips. BELLA looks hard at JACK, then leaves. JACK  pursues her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BELLA runs up the iron stairs to the gate at the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bella!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without looking back she flings the gate shut, goes off  down the street. JACK turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on. Go after her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARION slams the door to the flat. JACK is half-way up th stairs, alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rush hour. 6 in the evening. JACK watches MEN and WOM coming out the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack had no idea where Marion was  staying, or with whom. He realised  he knew little about her life. But  then, he had never asked about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK now sees MARION. He is about to go up to her, moving through the flow of the crowd, then he stops. A MAN in his 30s, tall with a moustache, greets MARION.  He's been waiting for her. JACK watches the two of them,  unseen. The MAN and MARION exchange a few words. She smiles, take his arm. He leans forward to kiss her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time in a long while  Jack thought about his mother.  She'd left when she couldn't take  it any more.  His father had said  'Don't worry, Jacko, she'll come  back.' She didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Marion wasn't his mother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK stands behind REYNOLDS who is playing back a video o the earlier incident in which MATT cheated with the GREEK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's paying out in stacks of 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He freezes the frame, presses a button, zooms in on the  detail of MATT's hand covering the chips. On another video monitor MATT is dealing blackjack. REYNO looks at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chapter Three. His existence was  forming an interesting pattern of  betrayals. Sometimes he was unsure  whether he was the betrayer or the  betrayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REYNOLDS looks up from the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grudgingly) Thanks for the information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pleasure. Pity about Bella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was a real asset. But what  could I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Sorry. No smoking in the Nest,  Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working at his computer, JACK lights one cigarette from  another. He pauses from his typing. On the desk beside hi is the note with JANI's phone number. He picks up the pho starts to dial, then stops, replaces the receiver. He loo distracted, lost. On the table MARION'S flowers are dead  in the vase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK comes downstairs from the upper floor. He is looking at a book he has selected: 'SCARNE ON CARDS'. Across from the cash desk near the entrance a book signin is in progress. A small crowd surrounds a Middle Eastern  author called HABIB dressed in a kaftan. GILES is with  him. A PHOTOGRAPHER is there. A few camera flashes. GILES sees JACK at the cash desk. He is uncertain for a  moment, then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling) Jack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing his name, JACK turns. GILES comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was you. It's the  hair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touching the back  of his neck) I'm working on that soccer story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (vaguely) Right. (suddenly) Look, I must get back to Habib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Habib?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My author. He's a Terrorist. He's  written a kill-and-tell book. (puts his hand on  Jack's shoulder) Take care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GILES heads back to the signing. The CASHIER puts JACK'S  book in a bag. GILES stops, thinking of something. He com back to JACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, look, next weekend I'm having  a house party. Here... (removes a card  from his pocket  book) It's near Oxford. Why don't you  come? It'll just be social. No  business. (conspiratorially) Bring a friend. I've plenty of  room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at the card) I'll try and make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking forward!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GILES goes back to his group. JACK looks round the  bookstore, sees thousands of books in piles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Books piled like chips. Stack 'em  high. Sell 'em fast. Make a killing.  You think you're a gambler, Giles,  but you're not. You're a dealer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A camera flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANI'S white Honda winds its way through the wintry  Oxfordshire countryside. The moon is bright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chapter Four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANI, wearing dark glasses, is driving. JACK, beside her, reads a map with a torch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how you can drive at  night with those glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and smiles at him. Her left hand is bandaged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you hurt your hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just an accident. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn left ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car turns into a lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jani, there's something I want to  say. Before we get there. I don't  know what the sleeping arrangements  are. Giles probably expects us to  share a room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Honda's tyres crackle on the gravel drive which leads to a floodlit yellow stone country house. There are three cars parked outside the entrance. The Honda stops next to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK prepares to get out. JANI catches his arm. She takes off her dark glasses. Her right eye is bruised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no point pretending it was  an accident. I had a fight with  someone, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance there is the sound of a tennis ball being struck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A floodlit tennis court. A racquet smacks a tennis ball.  JACK sits with GILES drinking Bloody Marys watching a gam of mixed doubles. Everybody's wearing sweaters. JANI is playing with one of GILES'S friends, GORDON. On the other side, two girls,  FIONA from Giles' office, and CHLOE, Gordon's girlfriend. JACK follows JANI'S game. She is far and away the best of the four. GILES is also studying JANI's movements, her knickers whe she serves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a dab hand With a racquet,  your friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: South African women are very sporty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK watches JANI'S strong leg muscles as she moves about the court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see. How did she get that  shiner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK has been waiting for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found her in bed with someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Who was he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say. You're a dark horse, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On court, Jani delivers a winning overhead smash. The fou PLAYERS shake hands across the net. They come off the cou GORDON puts his arm around JANI. His girlfriend CHLOE  notices. JACK is irritated. GILES catches the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jack) You don't play tennis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't play anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How boring for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANI moves deliberately away from GORDON, who clearly  fancies her, and sits down beside JACK. She pointedly kis him on the cheek. GILES glances at GORDON, who shrugs.  FIONA comes up to GILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's our drinks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're so bloody selfish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jack) I'm so glad you brought me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack wouldn't have come without  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK and JANI, GILES, GORDON and their two GIRLFRIENDS ar sitting down with drinks at a card table. GORDON opens a  fresh deck of cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't gamble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be a spoilsport. It's only a  few quid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing to do with money. I  don't gamble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GILES looks to JANI to persuade him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't gamble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insinuatingly) Jack likes to watch. (to Jani) Does he like to watch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK is getting angry. JANI is calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gordon) One more remark like that and I'll  break your balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is silence. GORDON is embarrassed. FIONA looks at  CHLOE, they're shocked and impressed. JACK smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) I'll bet she could, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK defuses the atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll deal, but I won't play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits down, picks up the cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you know how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK takes the pack of cards, splits it expertly into two shuffles by pressing the two halves together open-palmed. There is a rattling noise as the cards fold mechanically  into one another, leaving the pack as if it hadn't been  shuffled. FIONA and CHLOE are fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do that again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK gives the cards to his right, GORDON cuts them. Anot immaculate professional shuffle, and out come the cards  from JACK'S right hand, flicking across the table. As the cards land, they fall exactly next to one another  in front of each player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's sexy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the deal, five players are looking at a nea fan of five cards before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't they look pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all pick up their cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frowns) There's nothing pretty about this  hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not supposed to talk, Giles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's probably lying. He does that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK catches JANI's eye. She winks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. JACK deals the cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I've got an idea. Why don't  we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply) No! No stripping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. We're not having that again! (glances at Jack) Although...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stick to bluffing. That's  what I'm best at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANI smiles, says nothing. JACK slides the pack to JANI.  She looks up at him and cuts the cards. JACK deals the  cards deftly. The FIVE PLAYERS pick up their cards. Before each player calls we hear Jack's voice. In the end he correctly predicts their call. Is it telepathy? Or  something else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I don't know...Er...two cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PLAYERS examine their hands. The WOMEN are pleased.  The MEN say nothing. JANI puts her cards together. The betting begins. No one drops out. The raising goes  round three times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. I haven't got any more  cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The betting comes to an end. JACK watches as they turn  their hands over. GORDON turns over a Straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHLOE turns over a Flush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha. Ha. Ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIONA turns over a Full House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so fast, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disbelieving) Hang on, chaps. That's impossible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GILES turns over four of a kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's about that for impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter, cries of amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK is impassive. They all look to JANI, who turns over, one card at a time, a Straight Flush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. What are the odds for this  happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More laughter, cries of amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thousands to one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approximately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could've won if I'd been able to  bluff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANI leans forward and takes the pot. GILES looks at JACK then at JANI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get what? (smiles) Are you accusing me of cheating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good God, no. But with skill like  that, what do you want a job for?  You don't need to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK sits on the side of a four-poster bed and takes off  his shoes. On the other side of the bed JANI unzips her  skirt. She looks round the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here was an interesting question.  Was writing work... or play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANI puts her skirt over a chair and goes into the bathro She doesn't close the door. JACK continues undressing.  From a hold-all he removes a pair of pajamas. He glances  at the open bathroom door, then climbs into his pajamas.  He has two ugly bruises on his chest from the fight with  the ARABIC MAN. JANI comes out of the bathroom naked. She sees his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember the guy who cheated at  the table?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like cheats, do you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks across to her case, opens it, rummages around  and takes out a nightie. This, without the slightest hint of embarrassment. JACK goes into the bathroom to brush hi teeth. JANI climbs into bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which side do you like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling) You choose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get into bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That trick tonight, I don't think  I've ever seen that before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can only work with amateurs, A  pro would have spotted it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you're not a pro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANI leans over and turns off the lamp. Her hair brushes  JACK'S face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the deserted hall is a nineteenth century painting, a  copy of Gericault's 'Raft of the Medusa'. The picture lig illuminates the group of men and women, clinging to the  raft and to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack...? I need your help...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK wakes drowsily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owe a lot of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that why you did the two grand?  I couldn't help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that. But you can now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have any money.  switches  on the light. JANI is looking  distressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people I know, they're planning  to rob The Golden Lion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK sits up, turns on the lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't mean that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANI pulls up the bedcover around her body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My creditors. One night, around  three in the morning, they'll come  into the casino -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Forget it, Jani. It'll never work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The point is, they want a man  inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) And I thought you were a bright  woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just listen. You don't have to do  anything criminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Robbery's not criminal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK gets out of bed, tours the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to be criminal. A  man will come up to your table and  deliberately cheat. You'll see  him, stop him, and the guy will  make a big scene. There'll be chaos.  And that's when it'll happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't be committing a crime.  The man will cheat, you'll just be  doing your job, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK comes right up close to JANI in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I thought you were only after  my body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've come to know you. You're  honest. (takes his hand) I trust you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'll you do when it all goes  wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep the ten thousand pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What ten thousand pounds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANI gets out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These people will pay you ten  thousand before and ten thousand  after. They want someone they can  be sure of, an honest dealer. That's  the point. Not all dealers are  honest. Mr Reynolds will never  suspect you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reynolds? You've done your research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts her hand on his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know what else to do.  You're my last chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes his hand and puts it on her bruised eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time it'll be my neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about my neck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANI is close to breaking down. Her toughness evaporates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to go back to Cape Town, I  want to start again, clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it, Jani.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm asking you, as a...friend.  You'd be saving the life of a  friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANI goes back to bed. She turns out the light. JACK stan in the middle of the dark room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK comes out of the bedroom in his pajamas, wearing his hat. He walks slowly down the passage. He hears the sound of love-making coming from one of the rooms. He passes  'The Raft of the Medusa' as he goes down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK comes into the kitchen, switches on the light. He  goes to the refrigerator, takes out a bottle of vodka. He washes a dirty glass and pours himself a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack wondered why he was even  considering it. Ten grand. In cash.  That was why. But Jack didn't need  the money. His father would have  taken it, like a shot. But his  father was a gambler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He downs his drink, and leaves the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK walks back to his room. There is silence now, no sou of sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was always broke. Jake suddenly  realised... it was Jake who was  considering it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK comes in, tosses his hat on the bed. JANI isn't in  the bed. The bathroom door is afar. He hears the sounds o gasping. He rushes to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANI is holding her head over the lavatory bowl. JACK run some water in the basin. He helps her to her feet and giv her a glass of water. She washes out her mouth. She looks at him, tears running down her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to forget what I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, forget it. The bet's off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches forward for a toothbrush and starts to clean  her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your father? Can he  help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spits the water out of her mouth, kisses him on the  forehead and goes back into the bedroom. JACK looks at hi reflection in the bathroom mirror. He strokes his hair  down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just go back to South  Africa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK gets back in bed with JANI. They turn away from each other and prepare to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do you owe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they tell you to sleep with  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, all bets are off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK wakes as JANI is dressed getting ready to leave. She bends and kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to take the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him then leaves the room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on tightly... let go lightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK comes into the kitchen. GILES is making coffee. CHLO is sitting at the table, half-asleep in her nightgown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not particularly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your lady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had to leave early. She asked  me to thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bit unexpected, wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not entirely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that football story corning  along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it was going to be social,  Giles. No business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was overcome with a sense of  urgency. He had to get it down...  Chapter Five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK comes in, puts down his overnight bag. He yawns, hea for the bedroom. Suddenly, he sees that the vase of dead  flowers is now full of fresh blooms. Underneath is a smal box, gift-wrapped. JACK opens it. Inside the tissue paper is a tiny gold charm on a chain. He examines it. CLOSE-UP: The charm is a book, no title engraved. JACK is touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK comes into the room. MARION is in bed asleep. He loo at her, smiles. He starts to get undressed. MARION stirs. JACK puts the  book charm around his neck. She moves from the middle to  one side of the bed, making room for him. He holds the  charm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope it brings you luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARION I haven't brought you much luck, have I? Perhaps w shouldn't be together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That girl, she works at the casino --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I don't care about her. Of  course, I was angry. But not with  you. The book is yours not mine. I  was wrong, what I said about it. I  hurt you, didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're entitled to your opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's none of my business what you  write. And your job, that's none  of my business either. I love you.  And I've done everything wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK takes her in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll leave the casino soon. (he strokes her  hair) I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within a month. Believe me, I'm  going to quit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They begin to make love. She holds the back of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you can dye your hair blond  again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK is asleep in bed with MARION. He is murmuring  indistinguishable words. It wakes her. She gently touches his shoulder. He opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were talking in your sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not talking. Writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK is at work alone. The phone rings. He leaves it and  continues I working. Then he hears JANI'S VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to see you. I've moved. I  have a new number. It's 468-3275.  Please call me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a click. JACK scribbles the number down and resu work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK gets off a train. He is dressed as a croupier. He  walks to a public telephone on the platform, taking JANI' note from his pocket. He dials the number. The noise of  the train and PASSENGERS makes it difficult to hear. The  phone at the end rings and rings. JACK waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to speak to Jani de  Villiers... (waits) Jani... it's Jack... I'll come  over now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out a notepad and writes down the address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK walks down a street of rough, transient's hotels. Th street lamps are on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chapter Seven... Jack had decided  to see her. The challenge was  essential.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes up to a hotel called 'Journey's End'. He goes in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK climbs the creaking stairs under the fluorescent  lights. He knocks on a door. JANI opens it. She wears men pajamas. She looks unslept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances up and down the passage. JACK goes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANI carefully closes the door. JACK looks round the ding room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the Ritz this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She switches on a standard lamp, looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reflected in a mirror, she opens her bag and takes out an envelope, gives it to JACK. He looks inside. Four bank  packets of 2500.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't seem fair. You're  offering me ten grand in cash but  you can't afford a decent place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, life's not fair. We know  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all relative.  I need the  money too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The date's not set yet. I'll call  you. One last thing: the man you're  going to catch cheating, he may  get violent. But you know how to  deal with cheats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at her face) That bruise has cleared up nicely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruise? (touches her eye) Oh, yes. It's better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touches his chest) I've still got mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK looks at her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your hand too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coolly) I took the bandage off yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crosses to pick up a bottle of Scotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK puts the envelope in his pocket. They look at each  other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we should meet again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) It's a shame there aren't more men  in the world like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK goes up to JANI and kisses her on the mouth. She put an arm around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a part of Jani he really  liked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK comes out of the hotel, walks up the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Question: Was he gambling, taking  Jani's money? Answer: No. Because  he wasn't betting with his own  money. He was being paid in advance  for a service...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the roulette table JACK spins the wheel, throws the  ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In reality there were two clear  elements of risk in this exchange.  One: the possibility the cash was  counterfeit. Two: the possibility  Jani or her creditors would want  the money back if the plan failed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MIDDLE-AGED MAN is sweating. He fingers his last 2 chip He reaches for a number, hesitates. JACK sees that the  MAN's hand is shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To begin with he put the odds at 2  against. 7 for. He checked a random  selection of bills at a bank. They  were all good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the table a well-dressed JEWISH WOMAN in her fifti is sitting next to a YOUNG MAN, a gigolo type, the top  three buttons of his shirt undone. She too hesitates with her bet, looks down at her card, marked with the last thi turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now his odds were decidedly  better. He put them at 8 to 1. The  fact that the notes were good gave  him one less negative. 2 minus 1.  At the same time mathematically he  had one more positive. 7 plus 1.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WOMAN looks up at the YOUNG MAN. She hands him the  chip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring me some luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The YOUNG MAN smiles. Takes the chip and puts it on 21. The MIDDLE-AGED MAN puts his chips on 8 and 11. He prays  silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roulette table. The ball is bouncing in and out of  numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more bets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MIDDLE-AGED MAN closes his eyes. The WOMAN puts her  hand on the YOUNG MAN'S arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next stage. He had to be secure at  8 to 1 against having to give the  money back, so he wouldn't spend  it. If after one month no one had  approached him, he calculated the  odds of keeping it at 20 to 1.  After three months he figured 100  to 1 no one would turn up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ball bounces into 21. The WOMAN gives a cry of joy.  She grips the YOUNG MAN's hand. He leans over to her, eye her diamond necklace, and whispers something seductive in her ear. She stiffens with apprehensive pleasure. The MIDDLE-AGED MAN opens his eyes, there is a look of  misery on his face. JACK sweeps away the lost chips, pays out five minor  winners. He calmly counts a small pile of chips and slide them to the MIDDLE-AGED MAN by sleight of hand. Then he  prepares to pay out the WOMAN. No one has noticed the pay-out to the MIDDLE-AGED MAN. Th MAN looks at JACK incredulously. JACK smiles mechanically The MAN mouths the words 'Thank you' to JACK. The WOMAN looks up at the YOUNG MAN. She gives him a pile of chips. He gives them back. He kisses her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a drink to celebrate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MIDDLE-AGED MAN stands up, his face creased in emotio relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jack) Cash me in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK converts the green coloured chips to 35 in house  chips. The MAN nods at JACK, who smiles formally. The MAN leaves the table. PUNTERS place their bets for th next spin. JACK sees the MAN stop by the next roulette  table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake's experiment with the man  would prove the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAN hesitates. He can't resist. In CLOSE-UP: the MAN puts two of the chips down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People don't change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARION drops a plate as she's drying the dishes. She swea and bends to pick up the pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARION, undressed, pulls the old nightgown from the laund basket. She lets it fall back, goes to look in the chest  of drawers for another. She can't find one among the  underwear. She goes on to JACK'S drawer and pulls out a shirt. She  unfolds it. Out drop the four packets of 2500. She bends to pick them up. She looks at them incredulousl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK pushes several 50 notes into the slot and counts o two piles of chips for a PUNTER in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watched their faces as they  lost hour after hour, night after  night, relentlessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK'S FACE as he deals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He questioned the conventional  wisdom that gamblers are self- destructive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FACES of PUNTERS around the table: concentration,  grimness, apprehension...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had come to believe that in  reality, they want to destroy  everyone else - their families and  loved ones, everyone. Fuck over  the whole world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white balls lands. The FACES of the LOSERS, resigned, desperate, angry.... The PUNTERS who are cleaned out get off their chairs, tea up their sequence cards, turn and walk away, quickly,  slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without emotion he watched them  go. Jake stayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARION is lying awake alone in bed. The phone rings. She  leans over to pick it up, then doesn't. From the sitting  room comes the message:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's set. The day after tomorrow.  The twenty-fourth. Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click. MARION gets out of bed. She goes into the sitting  room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARION replays the message. She stares at the phone. Then carefully she presses the ERASE button, wiping the messag She goes back into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK is at work. MARION'S hands are massaging his shoulde The little book charm dangles round his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you ever tempted to gamble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks up) Never. Why do you ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can just imagine, being around  so much money all the time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gambling's not about money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gambling's about not facing reality.  Ignoring the odds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes her hands away from his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must be a fool. I never think  about the odds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of an underground train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK sits impassively among noisy Christmas TRAVELLERS.  The train stops. SOMEONE pops a balloon. JACK gets up and alights, followed by a streamer. He disappears into the  crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK hangs up his hat and coat, examines himself in the  mirror. He picks up a small roll of paper. He unfurls it. A Christmas party hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chapter Twelve...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Christmas festive atmosphere. The casino interior is  decorated with red and green balloons, silver and gold  streamers, a large tree hung with 1000 chips. JACK is dealing at a blackjack table. Like the other  croupiers and dealers, he is dressed in a fancy red coat  with green trim. He wears a silly paper hat. The PUNTERS at Jack's table include MR TCHAI and four  expensively dressed CHINESE MEN. The BODYGUARD stands beh them. They are gambling big money. Wads of 50 notes are changed into 100 chips. JACK is coolly winning for the house. REYNOLDS looks on  impassively in his Santa Claus suit. Three or four PUNTER are watching the CHINESE lose heavily. MR TCHAI and his  friends occasionally exchange a phrase in Chinese but the show no emotion as they lose. With each hand they prepare to lose even more. JACK pushes hundreds of pounds into th box beneath the table. REYNOLDS signals a SECURITY MAN to collect the cash which is building up. He comes over with a safety cart. During short break the money is taken from under the table in a  box, loaded into the cart and wheeled away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO COLD-LOOKING MEN in suits are drinking mineral water  at the bar. They watch the SECURITY MAN with the cart pas by and disappear through a green baize door marked PRIVAT One of the SUITS looks at his watch: five minutes to  midnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK is now at a roulette table. He sees a PUNTER's watch 2.45. The atmosphere around the crowded table is noisy,  laughter, loud voices. 1 One of the two MEN in suits from the bar eases himself into a chair. JACK sees him. The  SUIT throws him 500.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifties. Ten of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What colour chips?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK gives him ten pale blue chips and puts another pale  blue chip into the rack alongside the rainbow of colours  used by the other punters. The SUIT looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two men in raincoats, DETECTIVES, approach REYNOLDS and  talk to him. REYNOLDS becomes nervous, looks around the  casino. The table at the bar where the SUITS sat is empty The PRIVATE green baize door slowly closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ball bounces into number 5. There are cheers of delig from the winners, 5 is heavily covered. The SUIT casually slides a pale blue chip onto the number at the side. JACK Sees the obvious cheat. So do other PUNTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stiffens) Sir, I can't accept that bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUIT gets up and comes around the table to JACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you calling me a cheat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a cheat. I saw you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing Jack's  lapel) I'm talking to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK pushes him away. The SUIT hits JACK'S face with his  fist. Uproar around the table. JACK hits the man. The SUI grabs JACK and pushes him backwards across the table,  knocking all the chips over. The PUNTERS start shouting.  They grab their chips, especially the losers. One PUNTER  tries to restrain the SUIT. JACK kicks the SUIT hard. The fight, trading blows. At the blackjack table MR TCHAI and the other CHINESE see the fight. MR TCHAI barks at the BODYGUARD in Chinese. Th BODYGUARD heads for the fight at the roulette table. TWO DEALERS rush over to stop the fight. Somewhere in the distance there is the sound of a gunshot. PEOPLE start  screaming. The SUIT punches JACK in the stomach. JACK  doubles up. The SUIT breaks away, rushes across the casin pushing screaming WOMEN aside, heads for the door. MR  TCHAI's BODYGUARD blocks his way and fells the SUIT with hammer blow to the head. The TWO DETECTIVES come up. One of them handcuffs the SUI who is lying on the floor. The casino is in uproar. A  strange, violent Christmas party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK lies groaning on the floor. MR TCHAI is standing,  watching JACK. REYNOLDS'S VOICE comes over the tannoy  system:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, please be  calm. There's no cause for alarm.  Enjoy yourselves. It's Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REYNOLDS'S VOICE is replaced by a breezy version of 'Rudo the Red-Nosed Reindeer'. JACK struggles to his feet, amid the chaos. He falls back in pain. MR TCHAI and the other  CHINESE leave the casino with the BODYGUARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK is sitting in a Christmas-decorated cubicle, a curta drawn round. An INDIAN NURSE is bandaging his arm. He has two large plasters on his chest. The NURSE finishes the job, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him two pills and a glass of water. In the  background there are party sounds. The NURSE leaves. JACK fingers the charm around his neck. There is a pause. Then the curtain is pulled back. MARION enters. She carries a bottle of wine and two cartons of  Chinese take-away. JACK is surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know I was here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you wouldn't want to  spend Christmas Day alone in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to pour wine. JACK is still puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you go to the casino?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARION hands him a glass of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They touch glasses and drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now...noodles or rice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she opens the cartons, JACK watches her, still uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) I don't want a criminal for a  boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly) There was a message, wasn't there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's probably easier for you to  eat the rice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marion!  What did you tell the  police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give up being a croupier, Jack. Or  I'll shop you. All you have to do  is keep your word. It's that simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK sinks back on the bed. She hands him the rice dish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here...use a spoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone, Marion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're already alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had always been alone. He had  always believed it would make the  decisions easier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. I don't want to lose  you. I'll quit. I swear to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARION kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you take the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate public transport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to buy a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) How can anyone be that naive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK sits in front of REYNOLDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your time. Two weeks. Three  if you need it. We'll pay you sick  leave. I don't want to lose you.  You're a good man. Here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands JACK an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the envelope. Inside is a casino cheque for 50

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Happy New Year. Have a drink on  the company. You've earned it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK is sitting at his computer, drinking vodka, dressed  in his CROUPIER'S suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chapter Thirteen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He types... On the SOUNDTRACK we hear the CASINO noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all numbers, the croupier  thought. A spin of the wheel. A  turn of a card. The time of your  life. The date of your birth. The  year of your death. In the Book of  Numbers the Lord said: 'thou shalt  count thy steps'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a ring at the doorbell. He looks at his watch:  2.15a.m. The I ring comes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack thought, this is it. The famous  two in the morning knock at the  door.  It wad pay-back time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK goes to the door. At the door. It was pay-back time. JACK goes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he wasn't afraid. He hadn't  spent one penny of the ten grand.  He'd covered himself. He knew the  odds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK calmly opens the door. A UNIFORMED POLICEMAN stands  there. JACK hadn't expected this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Manfred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of the roulette ball bouncing against the numbe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICE DOCTOR uncovers a body on a gurney. The sound of the ball find-ing a number. JACK can hardly bear to look. It is MARION. With emotion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were the odds of being killed  by a car... on New Year's Eve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was on her way home... to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK looks away from MARION'S face. He sees the MAN with  the moustache, standing on the other side of the gurney,  the MAN he saw with MARION on the street. He is DETECTIVE INSPECTOR ROSS. JACK is disorientated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marion had been visiting his  mother...no, no, not his mother -  her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ross) She was visiting her mother. Her  mother. (suddenly) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Inspector Ross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did it? Tell me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs ROSS'S lapels. ROSS carefully removes JACK'S han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think it's a hit-and-run. A  drunk driver, probably, But there  is a possibility of a revenge  killing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distraught) Revenge? For what? Whose revenge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you know, she was a WPC with  the Met. up until two years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK fumbles in his pocket for a cigarette. There is a No Smoking sign on the wall. ROSS produces a Zippo and light JACK'S Gitane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She called me last week. She'd got  wind of a planned robbery at your  casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What had that got to do with her  death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't recognise the man who  attacked you, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly) Of course I recognised him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) You did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know a cheat when I see one. The  man was a cheat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSS sighs, looks at MARION. JACK suddenly reaches down and pulls the white sheet back over MARION'S face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ross) Do you gamble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSS is puzzled. JACK drops his cigarette on the floor,  grinds it with his shoe. ROSS gives JACK his card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anything occurs to you, call  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK walks away from ROSS without a word. The DOCTOR is  now filling out a form. From the door JACK looks back. ROSS waits for him to say  something. JACK doesn't speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in love with her, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a REPRISE of JACK covering MARION'S face with th sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his croupier's suit JACK walks the night streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quoting) 'The world breaks everyone, and  afterward many are strong at the  broken places. But those that will  not break, it kills. It kills the  very good and the very gentle and  the very brave impartially. If you  are none of these, you can be sure  it will kill you too but there  will be no special hurry'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He passes a poster for the National Lottery bearing the  legend: 'IT COULD BE YOU'. JACK doesn't see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN smashes a plate over a MAN'S head. It's plate- smashing party time, Greek-style. TWENTY drunk PEOPLE hav fun. Zorba music. Plates are thrown, stamped on, smashed. JACK sits alone at a corner table, drinking, watching the fun, unsmiling. One plate cracks into a wall behind him. MAN stumbles backwards into JACK's table. JACK swiftly  moves his drink out of the way. The MAN apologises, turns to JACK. It is MATT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacko! How're you doing? (shakes Jack's hand  vigorously) I heard about the raid. Pity they  didn't pull it off. I wish I'd  been there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATT has to shout above the noise and music. JACK smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) But you were there Matt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATT doesn't hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You know what happened to  me, don't you? That bitch Bella  shopped me. I'd like to beat the  shit out of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to buy you a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers. Happy New Year. I really  like you, Jacko, you're so fucking  straight. (suddenly) Hey, you haven't changed your  clothes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are four or five PEOPLE left among the debris. MATT has gone. JACK is still there, drunk now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music stopped, Jack was drunk...  hallucinating. He was back, as a  child, in the Wild Coast Casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLACK WOMAN comes over to him. Her name is LUCY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been avoiding me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blearily) Have I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what do you do, Lucy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a witch. A white witch. Why  don't we move on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to put a spell on  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCY guides JACK to a parked car. He is drunker than she. When he sees the car he starts to laugh. It is his Austin Healey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice car. How much did you pay for  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too much. Eighteen hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door for him. They climb in. LUCY starts th car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn left at the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deserted intersection. The Austin Healey swings around corner.  A WOMAN steps out from the kerb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK reacts. He swings the wheel. LUCY shouts. The car  swerves, missing the WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! I saw her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK looks back. The WOMAN is shouting after the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't trust women drivers, do  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack didn't trust anyone. Except  himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK sits at his computer. He is watching the printer  unloading page after page. JACK assembles the typescript.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was finally finished. He thought  of sending it to Giles. But that  wouldn't be right. He would select  a publisher at random, like a  number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP: The dedication: 'To Marion'. The sound of the ball bouncing against the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ball falls into 10. JACK puts the doll on 10. No one at the table has the winning number. JACK sweeps  away the losing bets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Blackjack table. The bets are placed. JACK turns over  the bank's cards: a KING and an ACE. He takes all the chi from the five PUNTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jack) You're wasting yourself. With your  luck you ought to come over to our  side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK comes up to a bookstore window. A sticker reads: 'IT A WINNER'. There are quotes blown up from the reviews: "A

dialogues.speaker: SCAMS, THE SLEAZE...A TALE OF TRIUMPHANT DISGUST...OF
dialogues.text: EXHILARATING CONTEMPT..." The display is just one book:  'I, CROUPIER'. Number 1 Bestseller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even his publisher had no idea who  the author was. He had done the  deal through a lawyer. It gave him  a good feeling, no one knowing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REYNOLDS is reading the book. He laughs out loud at  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It never occurred to anyone at  the Casino that the Golden Lion  had been his model. Why should it?  Weren't all casinos the same....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK is sitting in his croupier's suit on the crowded tub He sees a WOMAN reading 'I, CROUPIER'. For the first time we see the back cover...'by ANONYMOUS'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It gave him an exquisite  pleasure, being an underground  man. With all his money, he hadn't  even bought a car. Jack knew the  truth about himself, he was a one- book writer. A one time winner who  had quit while he was ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He changed nothing in the flat,  bought nothing, spent nothing. The  only thing he did was to remove  the bars outside the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK comes in. The phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANI is holding a mobile phone. In the background is the  casino room, the lights, colours, rattling sounds. She  waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK hesitates, then picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack! It's Jani.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The following conversation is INTERCUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jani! Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun City. I've been meaning to  call you for months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. I'm getting married. At  least, I think I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you solve your problems?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I'm all over that now. Jack,  hold on a minute. There's someone  here who wants to talk to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN'S hand takes the phone from JANI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacko - how're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK SR. his arm round JANI, talks into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never thanked you properly for  your help. Jani told me you behaved  like a perfect gentleman throughout.  I knew you would. I know my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK'S face is a mask, tight, fixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman thinks I'm going to marry  her. But you know me. It's a shame  things didn't work out. But we saw  you all right. You didn't gamble  the ten grand, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (huskily) As a matter of fact I did. But I  won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my boy. How's that novel of  yours coming along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK slowly puts the phone down. He takes a deep breath.  Then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that was it. The final card.  Blackjack. His father, eight  thousand miles and twenty seven  years away, was still dealing to  his son Jack from the bottom of  the deck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE-UP: A copy of the book: 'I CROUPIER'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But Jake the croupier had a  sense of humour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughing, JACK pours himself a vodka, raises his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To you. To both of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drinks at a gulp. He turns. Standing in the doorway is BELLA, wearing a nightdress. She is sleepy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you laughing at? Who was  that on the phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple I know are getting married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BELLA puts her arms around him lovingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A whistling sound...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are back in the FIRST SCENE. The ball bounces around  the spinning wheel. The FACES of the PUNTERS. Frozen  expressions. They are almost still. We do not see the  croupier. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now he had reached the point where  he no longer heard the sound of  the ball...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing moves except the little white ball in the spinnin wheel. The ball slows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the spin of the wheel had brought  him home to the place where he was  born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK'S face. A hint of a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The croupier's mission was  accomplished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ball falls into green Zero. JACK rakes all the chips  off the table. There are no winners. The film ends on a  CLOSE-UP of JACK'S face. A look of calm satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At last he was Master of the Game.  He had aquired the power... to  make you lose.
